title: What is the sgpa required for Mrd scholarship and cnr scholarship for 1st sem Chem cycle ?

comments.body: There is no min SGPA that can be known from before, since it's the top % of students that get. It depends on how the batch performs. If people generally do well, the min SGPA increases and vice versa
I meant like what is the cutoff generally like ? Any safe score or something like that

It varies a lot over the semesters. Some semesters have easy courses so the minimum SGPA is almost 9 at times, sometimes the courses are tougher and it drops to less than 8.5. Over my 4 years I've seen the minimum SGPA vary from as low as 8.2 to as high as 9.3. 

I'd say on average if you get above 8.5 you have a good chance at getting a scholarship for being top x% of your branch.
